[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: gcs_file_store_bucket_name] [Length Validation] Can extremely long bucket names cause buffer overflows or memory exhaustion in GCS API calls? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: gcs_file_store_bucket_name] [Character Validation] Does bucket name validation prevent injection of special characters, null bytes, or control sequences that could exploit GCS API vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: gcs_file_store_bucket_name] [DNS Rebinding] Can bucket names be crafted to cause DNS rebinding attacks during GCS API resolution, redirecting requests to attacker-controlled servers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: gcs_file_store_service_account_key_path] [Absolute Path Attack] Can absolute paths in service_account_key_path be used to read arbitrary files from the filesystem, potentially exposing other credentials or sensitive data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: gcs_file_store_service_account_key_path] [Symbolic Link] Can service_account_key_path point to a symbolic link that redirects to sensitive system files, allowing credential theft through legitimate API usage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: gcs_file_store_service_account_key_path] [World-Readable Keys] Does the implementation validate that the service account key file has appropriate permissions (not world-readable), preventing credential theft by local attackers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Field: gcs_file_store_service_account_key_path] [Key Reloading] Can the service account key file be modified after initialization, causing credential refreshes that might load attacker-controlled keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Integration: IFileStore] [Interface Mismatch] Do GcsFileStore and LocalFileStore implementations of IFileStore have different security properties that aren't properly abstracted by the interface? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Integration: FileStoreOperator] [Legacy API] Does the older FileStoreOperator API (used by create()) have known security vulnerabilities that were fixed in IFileStore but still affect this config file? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Integration: file_store_operator_v2] [Version Skew] Can mixing v1 and v2 file store operators cause security vulnerabilities due to different validation or sanitization logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Concurrency: Arc] [Reference Counting] Can Arc reference count overflow if file store instances are cloned excessively, causing use-after-free vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Concurrency: Arc] [Thread Safety] Are the IFileStore implementations thread-safe, or can concurrent access from multiple Arc clones cause race conditions or data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Concurrency: async] [Tokio Runtime] Can the async create_filestore() method cause runtime issues if called from non-async contexts or different tokio runtime configurations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Concurrency: clone] [Shared State] Does cloning IndexerGrpcFileStoreConfig create shared mutable state that could lead to race conditions when multiple instances operate concurrently? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Memory: Drop] [Resource Cleanup] Are file handles, GCS connections, and credentials properly cleaned up when IndexerGrpcFileStoreConfig or file store instances are dropped? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Memory: Leak] [Arc Cycles] Can circular Arc references between file store components prevent garbage collection, causing memory leaks that degrade indexer performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Memory: Allocation] [Heap Exhaustion] Can an attacker cause excessive heap allocations by providing large configuration strings or repeatedly creating file stores? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Memory: String Clone] [Sensitive Data] Are credential strings securely zeroed from memory after use, or do they persist in clone() operations and heap allocations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Error: unwrap()] [Panic on Error] Can the current_dir().unwrap() in Default implementation be triggered to panic by attackers manipulating filesystem permissions or chroot environments? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Error: Propagation] [Silent Failures] Do file store creation errors propagate properly, or can initialization failures be silently ignored, leading to operations on invalid file stores? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Error: Async] [Unhandled Futures] Can errors in async operations be lost if futures are not properly awaited, causing silent failures in file store initialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Validation: Missing] [Input Sanitization] Are bucket names, paths, and credentials validated before use, or can they contain malicious content that exploits downstream systems? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Validation: Regex] [ReDoS] If regex validation is used for bucket names or paths, can malicious inputs cause catastrophic backtracking (ReDoS), freezing the indexer? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Validation: Length] [Buffer Overflow] Are maximum length limits enforced on string fields to prevent buffer overflows in C FFI or unsafe code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/config.rs] [Validation: Format] [GCS Naming] Does bucket name validation enforce GCS naming conventions (lowercase, hyphens, length), preventing API errors or security issues? (Low)
